text:
★★★★☆

PAW Patrol: The Movie is the big-screen glow-up the pups always deserved: a fast, funny, and surprisingly heartfelt adventure that feels like a genuine event rather than just a stretched-out episode.

Taking the action from Adventure Bay to the gleaming skyscrapers of Adventure City, the movie finally gives the team real stakes: Humdinger as mayor (chaos!), a terrifying fireworks-trap finale, and Chase confronting his deepest fear of being "just a regular pup" after a traumatic backstory reveal that actually made grown adults in my theater sniffle. Ryder gets to be the coolest 10-year-old leader on the planet, and the new pup Liberty (voiced with perfect big-city energy by Marsai Martin) slots into the team like she was born for it.

The animation is gorgeous (those soaring aerial shots over the city at night are pure eye-candy), the set-pieces are legitimately exciting (the skyscraper rescue and the runaway trolley sequence had kids screaming in delight), and the jokes land for both toddlers and exhausted parents ("Good boy? I’m a good BOY!" still kills me).

It loses half a star only because the villain plot is pretty standard Saturday-morning fare and a couple of songs feel shoehorned in, but honestly? When the whole pack howls together on that rooftop while the city lights sparkle below, it’s pure joy.

Four stars: one for the upgraded animation, one for the laughs, one for the surprisingly solid emotional arc, and one because every kid in the theater walked out ready to save the world (and every parent walked out happy to have survived with a smile).

Perfect first-theater experience for little ones, and secretly way more fun than it has any right to be.  
8/10. No job is too big, no pup is too small… and no family movie night will be the same after this one. 🐾🏙️🚒❤️

Paw Patrol: The Movie (2021) I have to say it is simply perfect, it has no defects. It's an animation that manages to deliver a good adventure full of emotions, I've already watched the animation so I'm going to watch all the Paw Patrol movies.
I think the PPTM is better than Emoji movie and whatever bullshit

I loved this cute animated film. I been watching the show since 2013, season one. And seeing this franchise turn into a first animated film for the big screen is really shocking. I love the plot and the emotional scenes.
GOOD FILM FOR THE FAMILY
This was my childhood favorite show, and bring those pups to a big screen is even better. This movie had a good opener, plot, climax, and conclusion. This movie is absolutely perfect in every way

This is surprisingly a really good movie adaption of the show! I know I may be a little too old for Paw Patrol, but this is a good movie! My only problems is that the plot was kinda simple, the movie was kind of predictable, and Liberty was underdeveloped. But, still, a really good movie!

perfect for toddlers / small kids. my 14 month old was able to sit through the whole movie & seemed to really like it even though she hadn’t ever seen Paw Patrol before. not too exciting for bigger kids or adults
I was honestly surprised with how good this movie turned out to be! Same with the next one its actually pretty good!
Best kids movie ever! I really love the Paw Patrol Movie!

My main praise for this movie is the excellent animation quality. It is definitely a step up from the TV show's animation quality. The film is also darker than the show, which attracts older audiences looking for a good time.

Elevating the charm we received from the original show with dazzling animation in the big screen, Paw Patrol; The Movie may be generic, but it's still a paw-some animated feature for both kids and adults.

The PAW Patrol for the first time on the big screen! It was well said in the trailers that it would be a global phenomenon, it is a fun and emotional film at the same time, it is still an adventure focused on children, however it has moments that anyone can enjoy regardless of age. 90% in my opinion.

Intended on watching this for my younger siblings, but as the movie progressed, The story and characters got better and better. I cannot believe that what is made to be a simple children’s movie is so good. Overall great watch I would Recommend this movie to all families.

It's a little fanny but fanny is a good thing and there is a difference between everything's options on this move but it's not just this movie it's all movie's and you gotta respect other people's opinions

"Paw Patrol: The Movie" is a delightful dive into the world of animated rescue pups. As my first encounter with the franchise, I was pleasantly surprised by its charm. The plot is straightforward and engaging, perfect for a cozy Sunday afternoon. The heartwarming story and vibrant animation are sure to capture the imagination of young viewers. The humor, while hit and miss, always lands well with the kids. However, it would have been nice to see more of the other dogs besides Liberty and Chase, as the focus feels a bit narrow. Despite this, the film succeeds in delivering a feel-good experience with its simple, yet entertaining plot. It's a cute family film with plenty of heart, making it a decent watch, even if it’s not groundbreaking.

Fun, really well done and some great tension and character building in a movie made for younger audiences. Super well done, Chase is amazing and is really star of the show, I loved seeing him in action. 
Liberty was a poor character but everything else was great.
Overall a very well done and amazing! Good plot and exciting and impactful story driven material! 
Love it and Chase!
Paw Patrol is a great movie for the whole family. It teaches teamwork and never giving up!
This movie is adorable i love the fact that even when Chase had a fear of going back to Adventure City he still didn't give up and ended up liking it at the end 😍😍
